title: App color scheme suggestions + updated light/dark theme tokens

requirements.summary: Provide 3 cohesive color scheme suggestions and apply one selected scheme by updating existing theme CSS variables so the palette consistently affects the current UI in light and dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: A short list of 3 color scheme suggestions is included in the change description (name + brief description for each).
One scheme is selected as the default and applied by modifying the existing theme CSS variables in frontend/src/index.css for both :root (light) and .dark (dark).
Primary/secondary/accent/muted/background/foreground/border/ring/destructive/success and chart/sidebar tokens remain defined and produce a cohesive look.

The Login screen background gradient (currently using from-background to muted/20) and key UI surfaces (Header bg-card, Cards, TabsList) visually reflect the new palette without requiring component-by-component hardcoded colors.
Text contrast remains readable in both light and dark mode (e.g., primary buttons have clear primary-foreground contrast; muted-foreground remains legible on muted backgrounds).

file_operations.description: Add a short, reviewable list of 3 distinct app color scheme suggestions (name + brief description each) and clearly indicate which one is chosen as the default to implement. (This file serves as the required ‘change description’ artifact.)

Update the existing light (:root) and dark (.dark) CSS variable theme tokens (oklch(var(--...))) to apply the selected default scheme across the app (header, tabs, cards, buttons, dialogs, gradients). Ensure tokens remain defined for: primary/secondary/accent/muted/background/foreground/border/ring/destructive/success plus chart and sidebar tokens, with readable contrast in both modes (including the LoginScreen gradient from-background to muted/20).
